Passage:
Waivers and modifications. Generally, the Regulator will exercise the section 58(2) FSMR power sparingly and only in circumstances where there is a clearly demonstrated case for granting a waiver or modification of the FSMR, such as:
a.	to alleviate any undue regulatory burden on a Person in complying with the requirements in the FSMR in circumstances where investor protection intended by the relevant provisions is not reduced; or
b.	to apply to a Person upon request (i.e. on a consent basis) the provisions of the FSMR which, without a modification, will not apply to that Person. For example, an Exempt Offeror (i.e. a Person such as a government or government instrumentality included in the ADGM's Exempt Offeror List in APP 5) who is not subject to the Prospectus disclosure and the liability regime in the FSMR and these Rules may apply to the Regulator for a modification to section 61 of the FSMR so that it can make a Prospectus Offer of its Securities in accordance with the relevant Prospectus disclosure and liability regime in the FSMR and these Rules.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Assess the Need for a Waiver or Modification**: Determine if there is an undue regulatory burden or if you wish to opt into provisions of the FSMR that do not currently apply to you."

Obligation:2 "Demonstrate the Case for Waiver or Modification**: Provide a clear rationale and supporting evidence for the necessity of the waiver or modification, ensuring that investor protection is not compromised."

Obligation:3 "Formal Request to the Regulator**: Submit a detailed application to the Regulator for a waiver or modification, specifying the FSMR sections in question and the reasons for the request, with appropriate documentation."
Obligation:4 "Comply with Conditions of Waiver or Modification**: If granted, adhere to any conditions or limitations set by the Regulator, including compliance with modified regulations."
Obligation:5 "Notification and Disclosure**: Notify or disclose information to the Regulator or the public as required by the waiver or modification process."
Obligation:6 "Record-Keeping**: Maintain adequate records of the application process, the Regulator's decision, and compliance with the terms of the waiver or modification."

Obligation:7 "Ongoing Review and Engagement**: Regularly review the applicability of the waiver or modification to ensure compliance and engage with the Regulator as needed, providing additional information if requested."
Obligation:8 "Consult Full FSMR or Regulator**: For a comprehensive understanding of obligations, consult the full FSMR, relevant guidance, or the Regulator directly."

Listed funds – chapter 3. Chapter 3 contains, with the exception of the requirements in chapters 5 (Sponsors), 7 (Continuous Disclosure) and 8 (Systems and Controls), all the requirements applicable to a Reporting Entity of a Listed Fund. These requirements, whilst mirroring, and in many cases referring directly to, the requirements applicable to other Reporting Entities, have been otherwise tailored to take account of the characteristics of Funds. These include:
a.	general requirements applicable to Listed Funds;
b.	Prospectus requirements for the purposes of having Units of a Fund admitted to trading on a Recognised Investment Exchange; and
c.	governance requirements applicable to Listed Funds.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Compliance with Regulatory Framework:**
   - Adhere to the ADGM's regulatory framework for Listed Funds.
   - Operate the Fund in accordance with its constitutional documents and applicable laws and regulations.
   - Maintain proper records and accounts reflecting the business transactions and financial position of the Fund.
   - Implement adequate risk management and internal control systems."

Obligation:2 "Prospectus Obligations:**
   - Prepare and publish a Prospectus for Units of the Fund to be admitted to trading on a Recognised Investment Exchange.
   - Ensure the Prospectus includes all necessary information for investors to assess the Fund's assets, liabilities, financial position, profits, losses, prospects, and the rights attached to the Units.
   - Update the Prospectus regularly to reflect significant changes affecting investors' assessments.
   - File the Prospectus and any amendments with the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA).
   - Ensure the Prospectus is clear, fair, and not misleading."

Obligation:3 "Governance and Oversight:**
   - Establish and maintain a robust governance framework suitable for the size and nature of the Fund.
   - Implement policies and procedures to manage conflicts of interest.
   - Appoint a board of directors or equivalent governing body to oversee operations and ensure regulatory compliance.
   - Include independent members with necessary skills and experience on the board or governing body.
   - Appoint an independent auditor and ensure annual auditing of the Fund's financial statements.
   - Ensure the Fund is managed in the best interests of the unit holders and complies with fiduciary duties."

Obligation:4 "Continuous Disclosure and Reporting:**
   - Comply with ongoing disclosure and reporting requirements as specified in the regulatory framework.
   - Maintain adequate systems and controls as per the regulatory requirements."

Obligation:5 "Compliance with Additional Chapters:**
   - Be aware of and comply with relevant requirements in other chapters applicable to Reporting Entities of Listed Funds, such as chapters 5 (Sponsors), 7 (Continuous Disclosure), and 8 (Systems and Controls)."

Obligation:6 "Consultation and Legal Advice:**
   - Review the full text of the regulatory framework to ensure comprehensive compliance.
   - Seek legal advice or consult with the FSRA for guidance on specific obligations or applicability to individual circumstances."

Passage: Continuous Disclosure – chapter 7. Every Reporting Entity is required to make Disclosure of certain types of information either relating to the Securities of a Listed Entity or the Listed Entity itself. Such Disclosure is designed to ensure that the markets are continually updated with information that is likely to have an impact on the price of the Securities so that investors can make an informed judgement about those Securities. For this purpose, chapter 7 requires Disclosure of Inside Information, with carve outs for non disclosure of commercially sensitive information for a limited period, as well as Disclosures of interests held by Persons in positions of control or influence relating to a Listed Entity (such as Controllers and their associates, called "Connected Persons"), and the Disclosure of Directors' notifiable interests in the Listed Entity. The means by which Disclosure of the information required to be achieved are also specified in this chapter. Additionally, the conditions enabling a Listed Entity to request a temporary Trading Halt from making a Disclosure of Inside information are covered in this chapter.

Obligation:2 "Governance and Oversight**: Implement clear governance arrangements with defined lines of responsibility, ensuring senior management and the board of directors maintain oversight of systems and controls."
Obligation:3 "Risk Management**: Identify, measure, manage, monitor, and report on all relevant risks, including credit, market, operational, liquidity, and other risks."
Obligation:4 "Compliance Function**: Establish an independent compliance function with sufficient authority, resources, and access to the board or equivalent."
Obligation:5 "Internal Audit**: Implement an internal audit function to provide independent assurance on the effectiveness of internal systems, controls, and governance."
Obligation:6 "Financial Crime Prevention**: Develop systems and controls to prevent financial crimes such as money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud, and breaches of sanctions."
Obligation:7 "Record Keeping**: Maintain comprehensive and accurate records to demonstrate compliance with laws and regulations."
Obligation:8 "Conflicts of Interest**: Identify, manage, disclose, or avoid conflicts of interest."
Obligation:9 "Outsourcing**: Ensure effective oversight and supervision of outsourced functions, without delegating regulatory responsibilities."
Obligation:10 "Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery**: Develop and maintain business continuity plans to ensure ongoing operation and limit losses during disruptions."
Obligation:11 "Market Conduct**: Establish systems and controls to prevent market abuse and ensure fair and transparent business conduct in compliance with market rules."
Obligation:12 "Client Assets Protection**: If applicable, ensure proper segregation and protection of client assets."
Obligation:13 "Regular Review and Updating**: Regularly review and update systems and controls to align with regulatory changes and business model evolutions."
Obligation:14 "Reporting Obligations**: Comply with reporting obligations to the regulator, including submitting reports on the effectiveness of systems and controls."

Obligation:15 "Training and Competence**: Ensure staff are adequately trained and competent to understand and perform their duties in compliance with regulatory requirements.

Every Reporting Entity is required to prepare and file certain annual, semi annual and other periodic financial reports relating to the financial position of the relevant Listed Entity. Such reports are required to be prepared in accordance with the specified internationally accepted accounting standards and, in the case of annual financial reports, required to be audited. The requirements relating to the preparation and audit of the financial statements and the Disclosure of such reports within specified periods are set out in chapter 10.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Prepare Financial Reports:**
   - Prepare annual, semi-annual, and other periodic financial reports that accurately reflect the financial position of the Listed Entity."

Obligation:2 "Follow Accounting Standards:**
   - Ensure financial reports are prepared in accordance with internationally accepted accounting standards, such as IFRS or other standards recognized by the ADGM FSRA."

Obligation:3 "Audit Annual Financial Reports:**
   - Have annual financial reports audited by a qualified and independent auditor recognized by the ADGM.
   - The audit should be conducted in accordance with international auditing standards."

Obligation:4 "File and Disclose Financial Reports:**
   - File the prepared and audited financial reports with the relevant authority within the ADGM.
   - Disclose the financial reports to the public and the market as required by Chapter 10, adhering to specified timelines."

Obligation:5 "Maintain Records:**
   - Keep accurate and complete records that support the financial reports and facilitate the auditing process for a period specified by ADGM regulations or as required by law."

Obligation:6 "Ensure Regulatory Compliance:**
   - Comply with all ADGM regulations, including those related to financial reporting, disclosure of inside information, and market abuse regulations.
   - Be aware of and comply with any continuous disclosure obligations."

Obligation:7 "Notify Authorities of Non-Compliance:**
   - Promptly notify the FSRA or the relevant regulatory authority within the ADGM of any instances of non-compliance with financial reporting and auditing requirements."

Obligation:8 "Cooperate with Regulators:**
   - Cooperate with the FSRA and other regulatory bodies in case of inquiries or investigations related to financial reports or regulatory compliance.

For a comprehensive understanding and to ensure full compliance, refer directly to Chapter 10 of the ADGM regulations, any related rules or guidance issued by the ADGM FSRA, and consider seeking professional advice."

Passage: Working capital. An Applicant seeking admission of Shares to the Official List must satisfy the Regulator that it and any Subsidiaries have sufficient working capital available for its present requirements or, if not, how it proposes to provide the additional working capital needed.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Assess Working Capital**: Conduct a thorough assessment of your financial position, including assets, liabilities, and cash flows, to ensure sufficiency of working capital for current and future operational needs."
Obligation:2 "Forecast for 12 Months**: Prepare a detailed working capital forecast covering at least the next 12 months from the date of the admission application or document."

Obligation:3 "Disclose Working Capital Deficiencies**: If working capital is found to be insufficient, disclose this fact clearly to the FSRA, including reasons for the deficiency and the proposed plan to address it."

Obligation:4 "Include Working Capital Statement**: Provide a statement in your prospectus or admission document confirming working capital sufficiency for at least 12 months or detailing measures to address any shortfall."

Obligation:5 "Develop a Funding Plan**: If there is a shortfall, create a detailed plan for securing additional working capital, which may include raising capital through equity or debt, asset sales, or renegotiating terms with creditors."

Obligation:6 "Provide Verification and Support**: Supply evidence and verifiable financial information to support your working capital assessment and funding plans, such as financial forecasts, budget reports, historical financial statements, and financing agreements."
Obligation:7 "Engage with Regulator**: Work with the FSRA during their review of your working capital assessment and plans, providing additional information or clarification as requested."

Obligation:8 "Maintain Ongoing Compliance**: Continuously monitor your working capital post-admission, comply with ADGM's ongoing disclosure and financial reporting requirements, and disclose any material changes to the market in a timely manner."
Obligation:9 "Adhere to ADGM Rules**: Ensure all actions comply with relevant ADGM rules and regulations, including the FSRA's Market Rules (MKT) and any other applicable guidelines."

Obligation:10 "Consult Professionals**: Engage with financial advisors, legal counsel, or compliance consultants specializing in ADGM regulations to ensure accuracy in your working capital assessment and appropriateness of your plans to address any deficiencies."

Passage: Subject to (2), to be admitted to the Official List, an Applicant which has one or more controlling Shareholders must be able to demonstrate to the Regulator that it can operate its business independently of such controlling Shareholder and any Associate thereof.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Establish Robust Corporate Governance**:
   - Implement a corporate governance framework that ensures the company operates independently of controlling shareholders.
   - Appoint independent directors to the board.
   - Create independent committees for audit, risk, and remuneration."

Obligation:2 "Ensure Operational Independence**:
   - Manage day-to-day operations and strategic decisions without undue influence from controlling shareholders.
   - Conduct business activities such as procurement and sales at arm's length from controlling shareholders and their associates."

Obligation:3 "Maintain Financial Independence**:
   - Have separate financial systems and bank accounts.
   - Ensure the company is not reliant on controlling shareholders for funding or financial support."

Obligation:4 "Handle Related Party Transactions Appropriately**:
   - Develop policies to identify, monitor, and manage related party transactions.
   - Ensure transactions with controlling shareholders are on market terms and do not compromise independence."

Obligation:5 "Disclose Material Contracts**:
   - Reveal material contracts with controlling shareholders and demonstrate their market terms.
   - Show that these contracts are not critical to the viability of the business or that they do not undermine independence."

Obligation:6 "Comply with Legal and Regulatory Requirements**:
   - Adhere to all applicable laws and regulations, especially those concerning related-party transactions."

Obligation:7 "Documentation and Disclosure**:
   - Maintain clear documentation of operations, contracts, and corporate resolutions.
   - Make necessary regulatory filings and disclosures to the FSRA, detailing compliance with independence criteria."

Obligation:8 "Communicate with the Regulator**:
   - Provide detailed explanations and evidence of independence to the FSRA during the admission process.
   - Report any changes affecting independence status to the Regulator post-admission."

Obligation:9 "Ensure Continual Compliance and Monitoring**:
   - Continuously monitor the company's operations to maintain independence from controlling shareholders.
   - Comply with ongoing disclosure and governance requirements set by the FSRA."

Obligation:10 "Seek Professional Advice**:

Passage: General requirements

A Person may have the Units of a Fund admitted to an Official List only if:
(1)	in the case of a Domestic Fund, it is a Public Fund; and
(2)	in the case of a Foreign Fund:
(a)	it is a regulated Fund from a Recognised Jurisdiction; or
(b)	it is a Fund approved by the Regulator as a Fund subject to equivalent regulation as that applying to a Public Fund; and
(3)	it is intended to be a Property Fund, it is closed ended and 60% or more of the Fund's assets comprise Real Property.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Determine Fund Type and Ensure Compliance with Structural Requirements:**
   - Verify if the fund is a Domestic Fund and ensure it is structured as a Public Fund.
   - If the fund is a Foreign Fund, ensure it is either regulated in a Recognised Jurisdiction or approved by the FSRA as having equivalent regulation to a Public Fund."

Obligation:2 "For Property Funds:**
   - Confirm that the fund is closed-ended.
   - Ensure that at least 60% of the fund's assets are invested in Real Property."

Obligation:3 "Compliance with Regulatory Requirements:**
   - Adhere to all FSRA regulatory requirements, including disclosure, reporting obligations, investor protection rules, and maintaining proper records.
   - Implement appropriate governance structures for Public Funds, including independent oversight."

Obligation:4 "Application and Documentation:**
   - Prepare and submit the necessary documentation and applications to the FSRA for the listing approval process."

Obligation:5 "Disclosure and Reporting:**
   - Provide full and accurate disclosures as required, including prospectuses, financial reports, and ongoing disclosures about the fund's performance and management."

Obligation:6 "Investment Restrictions:**
   - For Property Funds, adhere to the investment restriction of having at least 60% of assets in Real Property."

Obligation:7 "Ongoing Compliance and Governance:**
   - Maintain ongoing compliance with all regulatory requirements and governance structures, including any changes to regulations or additional obligations imposed by the FSRA."

Obligation:8 "Consultation and Legal Advice:**
   - Engage with the FSRA or seek legal advice from professionals specializing in ADGM financial regulations to ensure full compliance and to navigate the application process and ongoing requirements effectively."

Pursuant to Rule 4.3.5(1)(c), the Regulator considers a Product Summary Note as giving a fair and balanced view of the Securities offered if the Product Summary Note:
(a)	gives:
(i)	a balanced description of the risks and potential returns of the Securities; and
(ii)	a proportionate level of prominence to the warnings, disclaimers and qualifications in relation to the claims on potential returns to which they refer to; and
(b)	does not:
(i)	give the impression that an investor can profit without risks;
(ii)	contain words or graphics that could convey an impression that is inaccurate or inconsistent with the nature or the risks of the Securities; or
(iii)	present information in footnotes in a way that would alter the meaning of the main text of the Product Summary Note or cause difficulty to an investor in understanding the Securities.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Balanced Description of Risks and Returns**:
   - Provide a balanced description of both the risks and potential returns associated with the Securities.
   - Avoid overemphasizing potential benefits without due consideration to the risks involved."

Obligation:2 "Proportionate Prominence**:
   - Give warnings, disclaimers, and qualifications related to claims on potential returns a level of prominence that is proportionate to the claims themselves."

Obligation:3 "Avoiding Misleading Impressions**:
   - Do not create an impression that investing in the Securities is without risk.
   - Avoid using words or graphics that could mislead an investor about the nature or risks of the Securities.
   - Ensure that the overall impression of the Product Summary Note is consistent with the actual characteristics and risks of the Securities."

Obligation:4 "Clarity and Comprehensibility**:
   - Present information in a way that is clear and comprehensible to the target audience.
   - Avoid using footnotes or additional information in a way that alters the meaning of the main text or causes confusion."

Obligation:5 "Overall Fairness and Balance**:

   - Provide an accurate representation that allows investors to make an informed decision."

Obligation:6 "Compliance with Regulatory Standards**:

Passage: Application. This section sets out the requirements that apply to a Person making an Offer of Securities of ADGM Green Debentures.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Prepare and Publish a Prospectus**: Ensure the prospectus contains all necessary information for investors regarding the issuer's financial status and the rights attached to the securities, and complies with ADGM regulations."
Obligation:2 "Obtain Prospectus Approval**: Seek approval for the prospectus from the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) before making the offer."

Obligation:3 "Demonstrate Green Credentials**: Provide a clear framework or methodology for project evaluation and selection, and report on the environmental impact to demonstrate the use of funds for sustainable projects."
Obligation:4 "Ensure Marketing Consistency**: All marketing materials and advertisements must align with the prospectus and not be misleading."
Obligation:5 "Maintain Ongoing Disclosure**: Fulfill ongoing reporting obligations, including financial reporting and updates on the use of proceeds towards green objectives."
Obligation:6 "Comply with AML and CTF Regulations**: Adhere to Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing requirements, including investor identification and verification."
Obligation:7 "Keep Accurate Records**: Maintain comprehensive records of the offer, investor information, communications, and financial transactions."
Obligation:8 "Conduct Fair and Transparent Dealings**: Deal with investors in a fair, transparent, and professional manner."
Obligation:9 "Implement Risk Management**: Establish risk management practices to identify and mitigate risks associated with the offer of the Green Debentures."
Obligation:10 "Complete Regulatory Filings and Pay Fees**: Submit necessary filings to the FSRA and pay any associated fees for the offer and ongoing compliance."
Obligation:11 "Register and Obtain Approval**: Register with the FSRA and obtain necessary approvals before making any offer of securities."
Obligation:12 "Obtain Green Certification**: If required, secure certification from a recognized green standards body for the debentures."
Obligation:13 "Adhere to Conduct of Business Rules**: Follow the FSRA's rules for fair treatment of clients, investment suitability, and conflict of interest management."

Obligation:14 "Establish Compliance and Risk Management Systems**: Ensure systems are in place for compliance with all regulatory requirements and effective risk management.

Please note that these action items are based on general obligations typically associated with offering securities within the ADGM jurisdiction. Specific requirements may vary, and it is advised to consult the relevant ADGM regulations or seek professional advice for precise obligations."

Qualifying Green Debenture Principles. A Security will comply with Qualifying Green Debenture Principles if it adheres to:
(1)	the ICMA Green Bond Principles;
(2)	the EU Green Bond Standard; or
(3)	international principles equivalent to (1) or (2), which are approved by the Regulator.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Choose a Recognized Standard**: Select either the ICMA Green Bond Principles, the EU Green Bond Standard, or an international standard equivalent to these and approved by the ADGM Regulator."

Obligation:2 "Ensure Adherence to the Chosen Standard**: Comply with the requirements of the chosen standard, particularly concerning:
   - Use of proceeds for eligible green projects.
   - The process for project evaluation and selection.
   - Transparent management of proceeds.
   - Regular reporting on the use of proceeds and environmental impact."

Obligation:3 "Provide Transparency and Disclosure**: Offer clear and accessible information to investors about the green debenture's adherence to the chosen standard, including environmental objectives, project selection process, and expected environmental impact."
Obligation:4 "Arrange for External Review**: Depending on the chosen standard, organize an external review or verification to ensure compliance with the green bond principles."
Obligation:5 "Commit to Ongoing Reporting**: Engage in regular reporting on the allocation of proceeds and the environmental impact of the financed projects, in accordance with the chosen standard."
Obligation:6 "Obtain Regulatory Approval**: If using an international standard equivalent to ICMA or EU standards, secure approval from the ADGM Regulator."

Obligation:7 "Consult with ADGM Regulator or Compliance Professional**: Seek guidance to ensure full compliance with all regulatory requirements and proper implementation of the green bond principles in the issuance process."

Qualifying Sustainability-Linked Debenture Principles. A Security will comply with Qualifying Green Sustainability-Linked Debenture Principles if it adheres to:
(1)	the ICMA Sustainability-Linked Bond Principles; or
(2)	international principles equivalent to (1) which are approved by the Regulator.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Select Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**: Choose relevant and material KPIs that are core to your business and the sustainability outcome you aim to achieve, which can be measured and monitored."
Obligation:2 "Calibrate Sustainability Performance Targets (SPTs)**: Set ambitious and meaningful SPTs that are to be achieved within a predefined timeline."

Obligation:3 "Link Bond Characteristics to SPTs**: Ensure that the financial and structural characteristics of the bond reflect the issuer's sustainability objectives and are linked to the achievement of the SPTs."

Obligation:4 "Provide Regular Reporting**: Offer transparent and regular updates on the progress towards achieving the SPTs, ensuring that this information is easily accessible to investors and other stakeholders."

Obligation:5 "Seek External Verification**: Obtain external review and verification from a qualified independent third party to confirm the alignment of the bond with the chosen principles and the progress on meeting the SPTs."

Obligation:6 "Adhere to Approved Principles**: Ensure that the sustainability-linked debenture adheres to either the ICMA Sustainability-Linked Bond Principles or an equivalent set of international principles approved by the ADGM Regulator."

Obligation:7 "Obtain Regulator Approval for Equivalent Principles**: If using principles equivalent to the ICMA principles, obtain approval from the ADGM Regulator before proceeding, which may involve submitting evidence of the equivalence."

Obligation:8 "Maintain Ongoing Compliance**: Continuously monitor KPIs, strive to meet SPTs, and provide regular reporting and verification as required to maintain compliance with the chosen principles."

Obligation:9 "Ensure Transparency in Disclosure**: Transparently disclose all relevant information regarding the sustainability-linked debenture to investors, including the framework followed, KPIs, SPTs, and methodologies used to track performance."

Obligation:10 "Complete Regulatory Filings and Notifications**: Make any necessary filings or notifications to the ADGM Regulator in relation to the issuance of the sustainability-linked debenture and adherence to the chosen principles."

Obligation:11 "Consult with Regulator or Compliance Professional**: Engage with the ADGM Regulator or a compliance professional to fully understand and meet all obligations under the ADGM financial regulations when issuing a sustainability-linked debenture."

External review. A Security will be considered by the Regulator to be subject to external review if the Issuer appoints one or more external review providers to:
(1)	assess through a pre-issuance external review the alignment of the Security with the requirements of the relevant Qualifying Green Debenture Principles or Qualifying Sustainability-Linked Debenture Principles; and
(2)	verify on a regular basis post-issuance the Security’s performance against applicable criteria outlined in the Qualifying Green Debenture Principles or Qualifying Sustainability-Linked Debenture Principles. Such verification must occur at least annually.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Appointment of External Review Providers:**
   - Appoint one or more external review providers to assess and verify the security's alignment with the relevant principles."

Obligation:2 "Pre-Issuance External Review:**
   - Conduct a pre-issuance external review to ensure the security aligns with the Qualifying Green Debenture Principles or Qualifying Sustainability-Linked Debenture Principles."

Obligation:3 "Post-Issuance Verification:**
   - Have the external review provider(s) verify the security's performance against the principles' criteria regularly, at least on an annual basis."

Obligation:4 "Documentation and Reporting:**
   - Maintain documentation of all external reviews and verifications.
   - Report the findings of the pre-issuance review and ongoing verifications to investors, stakeholders, and the regulator as required."

Obligation:5 "Compliance with Relevant Principles:**
   - Ensure ongoing alignment of the security with the applicable principles throughout its lifecycle."

Obligation:6 "Engagement with Stakeholders:**
   - Communicate with stakeholders, including investors and the regulator, regarding the outcomes of external reviews and the security's performance."

Obligation:7 "Regulatory Reporting:**
   - Fulfill any additional reporting requirements to the regulator regarding external reviews and compliance with the principles."

Obligation:8 "Oversight and Governance:**
   - Establish governance structures to oversee the fulfillment of these obligations.

It is recommended to review the full ADGM regulatory framework or seek professional advice to ensure comprehensive compliance with all regulations."

Prior to the appointment of an external review provider under Rule ‎4.15.6 an Issuer should take reasonable steps to ensure that the external review provider:
a.	has the required skills, resources and experience to undertake the review; and
b.	is independent of, and not subject to, any conflict of interest with respect to the Issuer.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Assess Skills, Resources, and Experience:**
   - Evaluate the external review provider's professional qualifications, technical expertise, and industry knowledge.
   - Ensure the provider has adequate staffing, technological tools, and access to necessary information.
   - Consider the provider's track record, previous reviews conducted, and understanding of the regulatory environment and your business requirements."

Obligation:2 "Evaluate Independence and Conflict of Interest:**
   - Confirm that the external review provider is independent and has no current business or personal relationships with your company that could affect objectivity.
   - Ensure the provider has no conflicts of interest, such as financial interests, affiliations, or connections that might influence the review's outcome."

Obligation:3 "Conduct Due Diligence:**
   - Request and review the provider's qualifications, references, and case studies of similar reviews.
   - Conduct interviews or meetings to assess understanding of the review's scope and nature.
   - Review the provider's client list, ownership structure, and disclosures for potential conflicts of interest.
   - Obtain a declaration or confirmation from the provider regarding their independence and absence of conflicts of interest."

Obligation:4 "Selection Process:**
   - Establish and document a process for evaluating and selecting external review providers.
   - Consider engaging in a competitive bidding process to select the most suitable provider."

Obligation:5 "Documentation and Compliance:**
   - Document all steps taken in the due diligence and selection process.
   - Ensure the ability to demonstrate compliance with regulatory obligations if required by authorities."

In order to benefit from the exemption provided for in the FSMR, a Buy-back Programme must comply with Rules 6.2.4, 6.2.5 and 6.2.6 of this chapter and the sole purpose of that Buy-back programme must be to reduce the capital of an Issuer or Listed Entity (in value or in number of Shares) or to meet obligations arising from either of the following:
(1)	Debentures or Sukuk exchangeable into Equity Securities; and
(2)	Employee Incentive Schemes or other allocations of Shares to Employees of the Issuer or of an associate Company.

(i)	actual or potential investors;

Obligation:9 "Compliance with Continuing Obligations**: Adhere to all ongoing obligations as set out by the ADGM FSRA, including regular financial reporting and disclosure of price-sensitive information.

Obligation:3 "Risk Management**: Establish a comprehensive risk management framework to identify, assess, manage, and monitor business risks."

Obligation:5 "Internal Controls**: Implement robust internal controls to prevent financial loss, fraud, and ensure the integrity of financial and regulatory reporting."
Obligation:6 "Audit and Assurance**: Establish an independent audit function to review and provide assurance on the effectiveness of internal controls and risk management."

Obligation:8 "Conflicts of Interest**: Identify, manage, and disclose conflicts of interest to prevent adverse effects on the firm's decisions and operations."
Obligation:9 "Fitness and Propriety**: Ensure that all members of the Governing Body, senior management, and employees are fit and proper for their roles."
Obligation:10 "Transparency and Disclosure**: Disclose appropriate information to stakeholders to enable informed decision-making."
Obligation:11 "Continuity and Succession Planning**: Have orderly succession plans in place for members of the Governing Body and key function holders."
Obligation:12 "Communication with Regulators**: Maintain open and cooperative relationships with regulatory authorities and disclose any information they would reasonably expect notice of."

Passage: Principle 6 – Position and prospects. The Board must ensure that the Listed Entity's financial and other reports present an accurate, balanced and understandable assessment of the Listed Entity's financial position and prospects by ensuring that there are effective internal risk control and reporting requirements.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Ensure Accuracy of Reports**: Verify that all financial reports and disclosures accurately represent the company's financial status, adhering to accounting standards and regulations."
Obligation:2 "Maintain Balance in Reporting**: Present both positive and negative aspects of the company's financial performance and position without bias."
Obligation:3 "Promote Understandability**: Present information in reports clearly and understandably, avoiding technical jargon and complexity."
Obligation:4 "Establish Effective Internal Controls**: Implement and maintain internal controls over financial reporting to prevent and detect errors and fraud."
Obligation:5 "Implement Robust Risk Management**: Develop a comprehensive risk management framework to identify, assess, manage, and monitor both financial and non-financial risks."
Obligation:6 "Comply with Reporting Requirements**: Adhere to all relevant internal and external reporting requirements, including those set by regulatory bodies like the ADGM FSRA."
Obligation:7 "Exercise Board Oversight**: Actively oversee the financial reporting process and ensure compliance with reporting obligations."
Obligation:8 "Conduct Regular Reviews**: Periodically assess the effectiveness of internal controls and risk management frameworks, making improvements as necessary."
Obligation:9 "Facilitate External Audit**: Support the work of external auditors by providing necessary information and ensuring their independence."
Obligation:10 "Maintain Continuous Disclosure**: Keep a policy of continuous disclosure to make all material information public in a timely manner."

Obligation:11 "Engage in Effective Communication**: Maintain open communication with auditors, shareholders, and other stakeholders, addressing issues promptly and providing comprehensive information."
Obligation:12 "Ensure Training and Competence**: Confirm that Board members and relevant staff are adequately trained and competent in financial reporting and risk management."
Obligation:13 "Disclose Control Deficiencies**: Report any significant deficiencies or material weaknesses in internal controls, along with corrective actions taken."
Obligation:14 "Provide Forward-Looking Information**: Offer assessments of future prospects, including known risks and uncertainties that may impact future performance."
Obligation:15 "Work with Audit Committee**: Collaborate with the Audit Committee or equivalent to review the integrity of financial statements and announcements related to performance."

Obligation:16 "Ensure Compliance with Laws and Standards**: Follow all relevant laws, regulations, accounting standards, and listing rules related to financial reporting and disclosure. 

By consolidating these action items, the Board can ensure they are meeting their obligations under Principle 6 – Position and Prospects, as per the ADGM framework. Compliance with these actions is crucial for maintaining investor trust and upholding the integrity of financial markets."

Passage: Principle 7 – Remuneration. The Board must ensure that the Listed Entity has remuneration structures and strategies that are well aligned with the long term interests of the Listed Entity.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Develop and Review Remuneration Policies:**
   - Create remuneration policies that align with the company's long-term goals and strategy.
   - Regularly review these policies to ensure ongoing relevance and effectiveness."

Obligation:2 "Ensure Oversight and Governance:**
   - The Board should maintain effective oversight of remuneration strategies.
   - Implement governance mechanisms to prevent conflicts of interest and maintain objective decision-making."

Obligation:3 "Align Compensation with Long-Term Interests:**
   - Structure executive compensation to reflect the long-term interests of shareholders and stakeholders.
   - Incorporate performance metrics that support long-term stability and growth."

Obligation:4 "Maintain Transparency and Disclosure:**
   - Clearly communicate remuneration policies to shareholders and stakeholders.
   - Disclose remuneration practices and outcomes in annual reports or other communications."

Obligation:5 "Integrate Risk Management:**
   - Consider risk assessments in remuneration decisions to discourage excessive risk-taking.
   - Ensure remuneration aligns with the company's risk management framework."

Obligation:6 "Engage with Shareholders:**
   - Proactively engage with shareholders on remuneration policies, particularly when significant changes are proposed or shareholder approval is needed."

Obligation:7 "Adhere to Regulatory Compliance:**
   - Follow all relevant ADGM regulations and guidelines related to remuneration.
   - Stay updated on and adapt to changes in regulatory requirements."

Obligation:8 "Utilize Committees for Support:**
   - Employ a remuneration committee, if applicable, to assist the Board with decisions on executive pay and remuneration structures."

Obligation:9 "Prevent Short-Termism:**
   - Avoid incentivizing short-term performance at the expense of long-term company health."

Obligation:10 "Link Remuneration to Performance:**
    - Ensure a significant portion of remuneration is performance-based and forward-looking."

Obligation:11 "Promote Proportionality:**
    - Remuneration should be proportionate to individual performance, skills, expertise, and the financial condition of the entity."

Obligation:12 "Structure Variable Pay Carefully:**
    - If using variable pay components, structure them to support long-term interests and not undermine them."

Obligation:13 "Implement Clawback Provisions:**
    - Include provisions to recover variable remuneration in cases of misconduct or significant financial downturn."

Obligation:14 "Consult Legal or Compliance Experts:**
    - Seek advice from professionals to ensure full understanding and compliance with all obligations."

Passage:
Annual reporting on compliance. The annual financial report of a Listed Entity to which this section applies must:
(1)	state whether the best practice standards specified in APP 4 (the "Corporate Governance Principles") have been adopted by the Listed Entity;
(2)	if the best practice standards in APP 4 have not been fully adopted or have been only partially adopted explain:
(a)	why the best practice standards were not adopted fully or adopted only partially, as is relevant; and
(b)	what actions, if any, have been taken by the Listed Entity to achieve compliance with the Corporate Governance Principles to the extent the relevant best practice standards were not adopted, or were only partially adopted; and
(3)	include a statement by Directors whether or not, in their opinion, the Corporate Governance framework of the Listed Entity is effective in promoting compliance with the Corporate Governance Principles, with supporting information and assumptions, and qualifications if necessary.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Include an Adoption Statement**:
   - Insert a statement in the annual financial report indicating the entity's adoption status of the APP 4 Corporate Governance Principles."

Obligation:2 "Provide Explanation for Non-Adoption or Partial Adoption**:
   - If not fully adopted, explain in the report:
     - The reasons for non-adoption or partial adoption.
     - Actions taken to move towards full compliance."

Obligation:3 "Prepare a Directors' Statement on Effectiveness**:
   - Add a statement from the Directors assessing the effectiveness of the Corporate Governance framework.
   - Support the statement with relevant information and assumptions.
   - Clearly disclose any qualifications to the statement."

Obligation:4 "Review and Understand Corporate Governance Principles**:
   - Examine APP 4 to comprehend the expected best practice standards."

Obligation:5 "Conduct an Internal Compliance Assessment**:
   - Assess the extent of compliance with the standards internally."

Obligation:6 "Identify Compliance Gaps and Plan Actions**:
   - Determine reasons for any gaps in compliance.
   - Develop action plans to address non-compliance areas."

Obligation:7 "Document Actions and Progress**:
   - Record the actions taken towards compliance and the progress made."

Obligation:8 "Prepare and Finalize Required Statements and Explanations**:
   - Ensure the statements and explanations in the report are clear, accurate, and detailed.
   - Have the Directors review and approve these before finalizing the report."

Obligation:9 "Seek Professional Advice if Necessary**:
   - Consider obtaining professional advice to ensure diligent compliance with the obligations."

Obligation:10 "Understand the Importance of Compliance**:
    - Recognize that these obligations aim to enhance transparency and accountability, and that non-compliance could lead to penalties."

Passage: Rule 9.2.10 reflects the "comply or explain" approach adopted by the Regulator in respect of the Corporate Governance Principles.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Understand the Corporate Governance Principles**: Familiarize yourself with the principles outlined in the ADGM's corporate governance code."
Obligation:2 "Assess and Implement**: Evaluate your company's current governance practices against these principles and make necessary changes for compliance."

Obligation:3 "Disclosure**:
   - Disclose your compliance with each principle in relevant documents if you comply with all principles.
   - Provide a clear and reasoned explanation for any non-compliance in your corporate governance statement or other relevant documents."
Obligation:4 "Transparency**: Ensure disclosures are transparent, allowing stakeholders to understand your governance practices and reasons for any deviations."
Obligation:5 "Review and Monitoring**: Regularly review your company's compliance with the corporate governance principles and monitor regulatory changes that may affect your obligations."
Obligation:6 "Board Responsibility**: The board of directors should ensure compliance with the corporate governance principles or provide appropriate explanations for non-compliance."
Obligation:7 "Record-Keeping**: Keep adequate records that support your compliance or explanations for non-compliance."
Obligation:8 "Regulatory Filings**: Submit required disclosures or explanations in your regular filings with the ADGM regulatory authorities."

Obligation:9 "Engagement with the Regulator**: Engage with the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) as necessary, particularly if your explanations for non-compliance prompt questions or concerns."

Passage: With regard to the opinion required under Rule 9.2.10(3), adequate information relating to the Corporate Governance framework of the Listed Entity should be included to support the opinion, such as the identity of its chair, any committees of the Board and their role and membership, the chief executive and persons undertaking key control functions such as the head of compliance, risk control and internal audit and how their independence is achieved. See also the Disclosure of information required under APP 2.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Identity of the Chair**: Disclose the identity of the chairperson of the board of directors of the Listed Entity."

Obligation:2 "Board Committees**: Provide detailed information about the board committees, including:
   - The role and purpose of each committee.
   - The membership of each committee, indicating which directors are members, the chair of each committee, and the diversity and balance of the committee structure."
Obligation:3 "Chief Executive**: Disclose the identity of the chief executive officer (CEO) and elaborate on their role within the governance structure."

Obligation:4 "Key Control Functions**: Identify and disclose the individuals undertaking key control functions within the Listed Entity, such as:
   - Head of Compliance
   - Head of Risk Control
   - Head of Internal Audit"

Obligation:5 "Independence of Key Control Functions**: Describe how the independence of key control function roles is achieved and maintained, including reporting lines, conflict of interest avoidance, and measures to prevent undue influence."

Obligation:6 "Disclosure of Information**: Ensure that all disclosures comply with the requirements under APP 2, which may include financial information, risk management practices, and other governance details."
Obligation:7 "Supporting the Opinion**: Provide adequate information to substantiate the opinion required under Rule 9.2.10(3), ensuring that it is not a mere formality."
Obligation:8 "Compliance with ADGM Regulations**: Verify that all disclosures and information are in compliance with the ADGM financial regulations and guidelines."
Obligation:9 "Record-Keeping**: Maintain proper records of all information and disclosures for accountability and future reference or regulatory inspections."

Obligation:10 "Timeliness and Updates**: Disclose information in a timely manner and keep it up-to-date as per regulatory requirements.

Passage: Listed Entities are required to produce an annual financial report in accordance with Rule 10.1.4.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Prepare Annual Financial Report**: Ensure the report complies with ADGM FSRA standards and requirements, including Rule 10.1.4 and applicable financial reporting standards such as IFRS."
Obligation:2 "Conduct Audit**: Have the financial statements audited by an independent auditor to verify accuracy and compliance with the relevant financial reporting framework."
Obligation:3 "Ensure Timeliness**: Produce the annual financial report within the timeframe specified by ADGM regulations, typically within a certain number of months after the financial year-end."

Obligation:4 "Provide Full Disclosure**: Include all required disclosures in the report, such as the directors' report, auditors' report, and any other statements mandated by the ADGM regulations or applicable law."

Obligation:5 "File and Publish Report**: File the annual financial report with the ADGM FSRA and make it publicly available as required, which may include publishing on the company's website or through ADGM's market disclosure platform."
Obligation:6 "Adhere to Additional Requirements**: Follow any additional content, format, language, or supplementary report requirements as specified by the ADGM FSRA."
Obligation:7 "Maintain Records**: Keep records of the financial reports for the period specified by the ADGM regulations."

Obligation:8 "Ensure Responsibility and Accountability**: The company's board of directors or equivalent governing body should take responsibility for the preparation, accuracy, and filing of the annual financial report."

Obligation:9 "Consult with Experts**: Refer to the complete text of Rule 10.1.4 and any related guidance or rules issued by the ADGM FSRA. Consult with a compliance officer or legal advisor familiar with ADGM regulations for full compliance."
Obligation:10 "Update for Material Changes**: Disclose any material changes or events that affect the financial statements after the reporting period but before the report is issued."

Passage: Directors' duties and fair treatment of Shareholders

Application. This section applies to:
(a)	the Board of a Listed Entity; and
(b)	each individual Director who is a member of such a Board.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Corporate Governance**: 
   - Ensure adherence to ADGM's corporate governance rules and principles.
   - Establish appropriate policies and procedures for Board and company operations."

Obligation:2 "Compliance with Laws and Regulations**: 
   - Ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, including financial reporting, disclosures, market conduct, and insider trading."

Obligation:3 "Risk Management**: 
   - Oversee the establishment and maintenance of a robust risk management framework."

Obligation:4 "Internal Controls and Financial Reporting**: 
   - Ensure robust internal controls are in place.
   - Maintain the integrity of financial statements and reports in accordance with relevant accounting standards and regulations."

Obligation:5 "Oversight of Management**: 
   - Supervise and hold senior management accountable for their actions."

Obligation:6 "Disclosure and Transparency**: 
   - Maintain a high level of transparency with shareholders and the market.
   - Make timely and accurate disclosures of all material information."

Obligation:7 "Duties of Directors**: 
   - Act in the best interests of the company, exercise independent judgment, and reasonable care, skill, and diligence.
   - Avoid conflicts of interest and manage any that arise, including those from related-party transactions."

Obligation:8 "Training and Competence**: 
   - Undergo regular training to remain competent and understand regulatory obligations.
   - Ensure Directors are adequately trained and informed to fulfill their duties."

Obligation:9 "Reporting Obligations**: 
   - Ensure the entity meets its periodic and ad hoc reporting obligations to the ADGM FSRA and other relevant bodies."

Obligation:10 "Fit and Proper Criteria**: 
    - Meet the 'fit and proper' criteria set out by the ADGM FSRA, including honesty, integrity, reputation, competence, capability, and financial soundness."

Obligation:11 "Shareholder Relations**: 
    - Ensure effective communication with shareholders and protect their interests.

To ensure full compliance with these obligations, it is recommended to consult the relevant ADGM regulations, such as the ADGM Companies Regulations, the Market Rules (MKT), the Rules of Conduct, and any other relevant guidance or policy statements issued by the ADGM FSRA. Legal advice or direct consultation with the FSRA may also be advisable."

(iii)	who is employed or appointed by a Person in connection with that Person's business, whether under a contract of service or for services or otherwise; or

Passage: Where a Person referred to in Rule 9.3.1 is required under any legislation applicable to such a Person to comply with a similar or more stringent requirement than the requirements in this section, compliance with those other requirements would be sufficient for the purposes of the relevant requirement in this section.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Determine if you or your entity is a "Person" as defined by Rule 9.3.1 within the ADGM regulatory framework."
Obligation:2 "Review and understand the specific requirements of Rule 9.3.1, including any reporting, due diligence, risk management, or other compliance-related activities it entails."
Obligation:3 "Identify any other legislation that applies to you or your entity and assess whether it includes similar or more stringent requirements than those in Rule 9.3.1."
Obligation:4 "Compare the requirements of Rule 9.3.1 with the obligations under the other applicable legislation to confirm that the latter meets or exceeds the former."
Obligation:5 "Ensure compliance with the other applicable legislation if it is similar or more stringent than Rule 9.3.1."
Obligation:6 "Document and maintain evidence of compliance with the other legislation to demonstrate adherence to Rule 9.3.1's obligations."
Obligation:7 "Regularly monitor for any changes in both the ADGM regulations and the other applicable legislation to ensure ongoing compliance."
Obligation:8 "Be prepared to demonstrate how compliance with the other legislation satisfies the requirements of Rule 9.3.1 in case of regulatory inquiries or audits."

Passage: For example, in the case of a reduction of Share capital, more stringent procedures such as a special resolution (i.e. a vote of at least 75% of the Shareholders in voting) may be required under the company law or other legislation applicable to a Listed Entity in its jurisdiction of incorporation. Where this is the case, compliance with the more stringent requirements applicable to the Listed Entity suffices for the purposes of compliance with the requirements in this section dealing with a Shareholder approval by simple majority in Rule 9.3.8.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Pass a Special Resolution**: Ensure that a special resolution for the reduction of share capital is passed with at least 75% of the shareholders' vote."

Obligation:2 "Comply with Local Jurisdiction Laws**: Adhere to the company law or other legislation applicable to the Listed Entity in its jurisdiction of incorporation, especially if they are more stringent than ADGM regulations."
Obligation:3 "Maintain Documentation and Evidence**: Keep accurate records of the special resolution, including minutes of the meeting, records of votes, and any filings with relevant authorities."

Obligation:4 "Notify Regulatory Authorities**: Inform the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) and/or other regulatory bodies of the reduction of share capital and provide evidence of compliance with the applicable requirements."
Obligation:5 "Seek Legal and Regulatory Advice**: Consult with legal counsel or a compliance professional to ensure full compliance with all applicable laws and regulations."

Obligation:6 "Ensure Ongoing Compliance**: Continue to meet all other ongoing regulatory requirements post-reduction of share capital, such as disclosure obligations, financial reporting, and maintaining the required minimum share capital."
Obligation:7 "Communicate with Shareholders**: Effectively communicate with shareholders about the proposed reduction of share capital and the implications of the special resolution."
Obligation:8 "Fulfill Filing Requirements**: File the special resolution and any other related documents with the ADGM and/or the local jurisdiction's company registry as required."

For example, in a situation where holders of Debentures are to be asked to vote on a variation of rights or terms, the Regulator will expect a Person referred to in Rule 9.3.1 to give due consideration to the requirements of Rules 9.3.6 and 9.3.7 as if it referred to the relevant Debenture holders.

Obligation:4 "Disclosure and Transparency**: Provide clear, transparent, and timely disclosures to all security holders to enable them to make informed decisions."

Obligation:5 "Compliance with Specific Rules**: Comply with the detailed requirements of Rules 9.3.6 and 9.3.7, and any other relevant ADGM regulations, which likely govern the procedural aspects of engaging with security holders."

Obligation:6 "Regulatory Expectations**: Align actions with the expectations of the Regulator, treating all references to "Shareholder" as applicable to all security holders and ensuring consistent application of the regulatory framework."

Obligation:7 "Review and Consultation**: Review the full text of the relevant ADGM regulations (Rules 9.3.1, 9.3.6, and 9.3.7) and consult with compliance or legal professionals to ensure that policies and procedures are fully compliant with the regulations."

Obligation:2 "Capacity Assessment**: Regularly evaluate personal capacity to fulfill directorial responsibilities, considering other professional and personal commitments."

Obligation:3 "Understand the Business**: Gain and maintain a thorough understanding of the company's operations, financial status, business model, strategic direction, risk profile, and industry challenges."
Obligation:4 "Stay Informed**: Keep updated on the company's affairs, market developments, and regulatory changes affecting the business."
Obligation:5 "Exercise Due Diligence**: Be thorough in reviewing company matters, ask probing questions, seek clarification, and make well-informed decisions."
Obligation:6 "Act with Care**: Make decisions attentively and in the best interest of the company and its stakeholders."
Obligation:7 "Compliance with Laws and Regulations**: Ensure the company adheres to all applicable laws, regulations, and financial reporting standards."
Obligation:8 "Adhere to Best Practice Standards**: Familiarize with and follow best practice standards outlined in APP 4 and Corporate Governance Principles."
Obligation:9 "Engage in Continuous Education**: Participate in ongoing education and training to stay informed on laws, regulations, and industry developments."
Obligation:10 "Active Participation**: Engage actively in board discussions, offer insights, and contribute to decision-making processes."
Obligation:11 "Conflict of Interest Management**: Disclose any potential or actual conflicts of interest and recuse from related decisions."
Obligation:12 "Risk Management Oversight**: Be involved in establishing and overseeing the company's risk management framework."
Obligation:13 "Financial Reporting Oversight**: Oversee the integrity of financial reporting and compliance with accounting standards."
Obligation:14 "Corporate Governance Compliance**: Ensure adherence to Corporate Governance Principles and other governance standards."
Obligation:15 "Effective Stakeholder Communication**: Maintain effective communication with shareholders and other stakeholders, considering their interests in board decisions."

Passage: Equality of treatment. Subject to Rules 9.3.14 to 9.3.17, the Board of a Listed Entity must ensure equality of treatment of all holders of Securities of a particular class or type in respect of all rights attaching to the Securities of that class or type of Securities.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Ensure Fair and Equal Treatment**: Guarantee that all security holders within the same class are treated equally and fairly in all aspects, including access to information, voting rights, and participation in corporate actions."

Obligation:2 "Administer Corporate Actions Equitably**: Conduct corporate actions such as dividend payments, stock splits, or rights issues without favoritism, ensuring all eligible security holders have the same opportunities."
Obligation:3 "Apply Voting Rights Uniformly**: Ensure that voting rights are applied consistently and without prejudice to all holders of the same class of securities."
Obligation:4 "Simultaneous Information Disclosure**: Disclose relevant and material information to all security holders of the same class at the same time to prevent information asymmetry."
Obligation:5 "Prevent Insider Information Misuse**: Take measures to prevent the misuse of insider information that could lead to unequal treatment of security holders."
Obligation:6 "Manage Conflicts of Interest**: Identify and manage any conflicts of interest that could result in unequal treatment of security holders."

Obligation:7 "Comply with Specific ADGM Rules**: Adhere to all relevant ADGM regulations, including Rules 9.3.14 to 9.3.17, which may contain exceptions or additional provisions related to the equality of treatment principle."
Obligation:8 "Monitor and Enforce Compliance**: Regularly monitor compliance with these obligations and enforce them when necessary."
Obligation:9 "Establish Policies and Procedures**: Develop and maintain policies and procedures to ensure compliance with the principle of equal treatment."

Obligation:10 "Regulatory Reporting and Disclosure**: Report on compliance with these obligations to the relevant regulatory authorities and disclose such compliance to shareholders as required by ADGM regulations."
Obligation:11 "Review ADGM Regulations**: Thoroughly review the full context of the ADGM regulations, especially Rules 9.3.14 to 9.3.17, to understand any exceptions or specific conditions."
Obligation:12 "Consult with Professionals**: Seek advice from legal or compliance professionals to ensure full compliance with ADGM regulations and other applicable laws."

Reduction of Share capital. The Board of a Listed Entity must ensure that a Listed Entity does not purchase its own Shares unless:
(1)	the purchase does not materially prejudice the Listed Entity's ability to pay its creditors as they fall due;
(2)	it has obtained prior approval of Shareholders in meeting by a majority vote; and
(3)	prior to the meeting seeking the consent referred to in (2), the notice of the meeting and any accompanying documents relating to the purchase is filed with the Regulator.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Assess Impact on Solvency:**
   - Conduct a thorough financial assessment to ensure the share repurchase does not materially prejudice the entity's ability to pay its creditors."

Obligation:2 "Obtain Shareholder Approval:**
   - Secure prior approval from shareholders through a majority vote at a properly convened meeting, ensuring the process adheres to the entity's articles of association and relevant laws."

Obligation:3 "File Documentation with the Regulator:**
   - Prepare and file the notice of the meeting and any related documents with the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) before the shareholders' meeting."

Obligation:4 "Compliance with ADGM Regulations:**
   - Ensure all actions related to the share purchase comply with ADGM regulations, including those specific to listed entities and share capital reductions."

Obligation:5 "Record-Keeping:**
   - Maintain accurate records of all proceedings, assessments, filings, and resolutions related to the share purchase."

Obligation:6 "Disclosure and Reporting:**
   - Disclose the share purchase to the market if required under ADGM's market disclosure rules and ensure all disclosures are timely and accurate."

Obligation:7 "Adherence to Shareholder Approval:**
   - Execute the share purchase in strict accordance with the terms approved by shareholders, and obtain additional approval and make further filings with the regulator if there are any deviations from the approved terms."

The Board of a Listed Entity must ensure that all the necessary information and facilities are available to its Shareholders to enable them to exercise the rights attaching to their Shares on a well informed basis.

   - Establish clear communication channels, including providing annual reports, interim statements, notices of meetings, and proxy forms."

Obligation:3 "General Meetings:**
   - Facilitate the convening of AGMs and EGMs, ensuring proper notice and the inclusion of the agenda, proposed resolutions, and relevant documents.
   - Conduct meetings in a manner that allows for meaningful shareholder participation."

   - Provide a fair, transparent, and secure voting process, whether in person, by proxy, electronically, or via postal votes.
   - Ensure the proxy voting process respects shareholders' intentions."

Obligation:5 "Shareholder Queries and Concerns:**
   - Respond to shareholder queries and concerns effectively and efficiently, possibly through a dedicated team or corporate secretary.
   - Have a system in place for dealing with shareholder complaints."

Obligation:6 "Corporate Governance and Shareholder Participation:**
   - Uphold high standards of corporate governance and protect shareholder rights.
   - Encourage and facilitate shareholder participation in decision-making processes."

Obligation:7 "Compliance with Laws and Regulations:**
   - Comply with all relevant ADGM regulations, rules, guidelines, and any other applicable legal and regulatory requirements.
   - Ensure adherence to Market Rules, Companies Regulations, and securities laws."

Obligation:8 "Facilitation of Rights and Fair Treatment:**
   - Ensure shareholders can exercise their rights, such as attending meetings, voting, and participating in significant corporate actions.
   - Treat all shareholders equitably, including minority and foreign shareholders, without undue difficulty or discrimination."

Obligation:9 "Record Keeping:**
   - Maintain accurate records of shareholder communications, votes, meeting minutes, and share ownership."

Obligation:10 "Advising Shareholders:**
    - Advise shareholders on how to exercise their rights and inform them of any changes affecting those rights."

Obligation:11 "Transparency and Fairness:**
    - Avoid selective disclosure and ensure all shareholders receive the same information simultaneously.

These action items are essential for maintaining market integrity, protecting shareholder interests, and ensuring regulatory compliance within the ADGM framework. Board members should regularly review these obligations and consult legal advisors to ensure full compliance."

Definitions. In this section, unless otherwise provided:
(1)	a Person is a Related Party of a Listed Entity if that Person:
(a)	is, or was within the 12 months before the date of the Related Party Transaction:
(i)	a Director of the Listed Entity or a member of its Group; or
(ii)	a Related Party Associate of a Person referred to in (1)(a)(i);
(b)	owns, or has owned within 12 months before the date of the Related Party Transaction, voting Securities carrying more than 10% of the voting rights attaching to all the voting Securities of either the Listed Entity or a member of its Group; or
(c)	is a Person exercising or having the ability to exercise significant influence over the Listed Entity or a Related Party Associate of such a Person.
(2)	Subject to Rule 9.5.4, a transaction is a Related Party Transaction if it is a transaction:
(a)	between a Listed Entity and a Related Party;
(b)	entered into pursuant to an arrangement between the Listed Entity and the Related Party under which the Listed Entity and the Related Party both invest in another Undertaking or asset, or provide financial assistance to another Undertaking;
(c)	between the Listed Entity and any other Person, the purpose or effect of which is to benefit a Related Party; or
(d)	of the kind referred to in (a) to (c) and is between a subsidiary of a Listed Entity and a Related Party of the Listed Entity.

Regulator’s consent to sale of Restricted Securities in a Takeover or Merger. The Regulator will not provide its consent under Rule 9.6.11 unless, to the extent to which they are applicable, all the following requirements are met:
(1)	where there is an offer for Securities:
(a)	the offer is for all of the Ordinary Securities or, if the Restricted Securities are not Ordinary Securities, all the Securities in the same class as the Restricted Securities;

DefinedTerms.Equity Securities: Means Shares, Warrants over Shares, Certificates over Shares, Units in a Fund, Convertible Securities, and any Security that the Regulator decides to classify as an Equity Security.

Passage:
Restrictions on new Issues of Equity Securities . A Listed Entity must not issue, or agree to issue, more Equity Securities than the number calculated according to the following formula, without the approval of the holders of Ordinary Securities:
Maximum number of Equity Securities = (20% * Base Amount) – Relevant Issues),
where:
Base Amount = the number of fully paid Ordinary Securities on issue as of the date 12 months before the date of issue or agreement (the “12 months Base Amount”), plus the number of:
(1)	fully paid Ordinary Securities issued in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement under an exception in Rule 9.7.4 other than exceptions (8), (15) or (16);
(2)	fully paid Ordinary Securities issued in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement under an exception in Rule 9.7.4 other than exception (15), where the agreement was:
(i)	entered into before the commencement of the 12 month period; or
(ii)	approved, or taken under the Rules to have been approved, under Rule 9.7.1 or Rule 9.7.5; and
(3)	any other fully paid Ordinary Securities issued in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement with approval under Rule 9.7.1 or Rule 9.7.5;
Guidance
The Base Amount may include fully paid Ordinary Securities issued in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement under an agreement to issue Securities within Rule 9.7.4 exception (14) where the issue is subsequently approved under Rule 9.7.1.
(4)	partly paid Ordinary Securities that became fully paid in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement,
but subtracting the number of fully paid Ordinary Securities cancelled in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement.
Relevant Issues = the number of Equity Securities issued, or agreed to be issued, in the 12 months before the date of issue or agreement to issue other than:
(a)	with the approval of the holders of its Ordinary Securities under Rule 9.7.1 or Rule 9.7.5; or
(b)	under an exception in Rule 9.7.4.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Obtain Shareholder Approval**: Before issuing more equity securities than the calculated maximum, secure approval from the holders of Ordinary Securities."

Obligation:2 "Calculate Maximum Issuance**:
   - Determine the Base Amount using the number of fully paid Ordinary Securities on issue 12 months prior to the new issue or agreement.
   - Adjust the Base Amount by adding:
     - Fully paid Ordinary Securities issued under certain exceptions or with approval in the past 12 months.
     - Partly paid Ordinary Securities that became fully paid in the past 12 months.
   - Subtract any fully paid Ordinary Securities cancelled in the past 12 months."

Obligation:3 "Determine Relevant Issues**: Exclude from the calculation any Equity Securities issued or agreed to be issued in the past 12 months with the approval of Ordinary Securities holders or under specified exceptions."
Obligation:4 "Adhere to Issuance Rules**: Ensure that any issuance of Equity Securities is either within the exceptions provided or has been approved as required by the rules."
Obligation:5 "Maintain Records**: Keep accurate records of all issuances and cancellations of Ordinary Securities, including details of exceptions and approvals, to demonstrate compliance."

Obligation:6 "Communicate with Shareholders**: If planning to issue more Equity Securities than the formula allows without prior approval, engage with Ordinary Securities holders to obtain their consent."
Obligation:7 "Follow Guidance**: Adhere to any additional guidance related to the rules, such as the inclusion of securities issued under certain agreements that are later approved."
Obligation:8 "Report to Regulatory Authority**: Comply with reporting requirements to the ADGM regulatory authority as stipulated by the governing rules and regulations."
Obligation:9 "Seek Professional Advice**: Consult with compliance teams or legal advisors to ensure understanding and adherence to all regulatory requirements before issuing any Equity Securities."

Under Rule 10.2.7 a Public Listed Company must require its auditor to conduct an audit of its financial statements in accordance with the requirements of the relevant standards published by the International Auditing and Assurance Standards Board (IAASB) in respect of its financial business or other standards acceptable to the Regulator and produce audit reports as specified in GEN.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Select and Appoint an Auditor:**
   - Identify and choose a qualified auditor or audit firm that is registered, recognized, and authorized to practice within the ADGM.
   - Ensure the auditor has the necessary expertise for your specific financial business sector."

Obligation:2 "Audit Engagement:**
   - Enter into an audit engagement with the auditor, clearly outlining the scope and nature of the audit work."

Obligation:3 "Audit Process:**
   - Provide the auditor with access to all necessary records, documentation, and information for the audit.
   - Facilitate open communication between your company's management and the auditor."

Obligation:4 "Compliance with Audit Standards:**
   - Confirm the auditor conducts the audit in accordance with IAASB standards or other standards acceptable to the FSRA.
   - Stay informed about any changes to the auditing standards and communicate these to the auditor."

Obligation:5 "Production and Review of Audit Reports:**
   - Ensure the auditor prepares and delivers audit reports as specified in the GEN rulebook or module.
   - Review the audit reports to understand findings and address any identified issues."

Obligation:6 "Regulatory Filings:**
   - File the audited financial statements and audit reports with the ADGM FSRA within prescribed timelines and formats."

Obligation:7 "Ongoing Compliance and Record-Keeping:**
   - Monitor ongoing compliance with FSMR, GEN, and other relevant regulations.
   - Establish internal policies and procedures for continuous compliance with audit requirements.
   - Maintain records of the audit work and reports as per ADGM regulations and be prepared to present these to the FSRA upon request.

By following these consolidated action items, you will ensure compliance with the ADGM's regulatory requirements for the appointment and role of auditors for Public Listed Companies."

Obligations: Obligation:1 "Prepare a Semi-Annual Financial Report**: Prepare a financial report covering the first six months of the financial year."

Obligation:2 "Content Requirements**: Ensure the semi-annual financial report includes:

Obligation:3 "Filing the Report**: File the semi-annual financial report with the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) within the specified timeframe."
Obligation:4 "Public Disclosure**: Make the semi-annual financial report publicly available for transparency and to inform shareholders and potential investors."

Obligation:7 "Responsibility Statement**: Include a statement by the directors of the entity taking responsibility for the content of the report."

A Reporting Entity must:

(a)	an explanation as to why the Mining Reporting Entity believes it has a reasonable basis for disclosing a Production Target wholly based on Inferred Mineral Resources;
(b)	the level of confidence in relation to which the Inferred Mineral Resources are estimated and the basis for that level of confidence;
(c)	a Technical Study of a sufficient level of confidence to support the Production Target, prepared by, or under the supervision of, a named independent Competent Person(s); and
(d)	an at least equally prominent, and proximate, statement to the effect that:
“The level of geological confidence associated with inferred mineral resources is low. Though further evaluation and/or exploration work is required to establish sufficient confidence that the production target will be met, there is no certainty that further evaluation and/or exploration work will result in the determination of indicated mineral resources or that the production target itself will be realised.  The mining reporting entity’s production target is based on its current expectation of future results or events, and should not be solely relied upon by investors when making investment decisions.”

Any statement about a Production Target will be deemed to be misleading unless the person making the statement has reasonable grounds for making the statement.  The Regulator considers that it is only under exceptional circumstances that a Mining Reporting Entity might form a view that it has reasonable grounds for a Production Target to be wholly based on Inferred Mineral Resources.

(7)	if the Production Target is in part based on an Exploration Target:
(a)	a statement of the factors that lead the Mining Reporting Entity to believe that it has a reasonable basis for disclosing a Production Target based, in part, on an Exploration Target; and
(b)	an at least equally prominent, and proximate, statement to the effect that:
